In the age of the Anthropocene, life begins.

Guiding the way to an oasis of dignity.

poem:
"In the Throes of Yuletide Gathering"

Potatoes snagged delicately,
Harvest held in hands 
Once finely boned.
On screens the feast out-glitters stars,
Applauses sought, echoes caught,
Yet amidst the gleaming shimmers,
The bells, the sidewinding tinsel,
The meat turns cold.
We swallow festive plumping,
Taste the severity of celebration,
A trophy that returns,
Again and again, 
To politely applauding mouths.

poem:
Title: The Christmas Ballet

In the holidays' tender caress,
Crisp potatoes and butter confess,
Under watch of lights that twine,
An aromatic dance divine. 

An applause unfurls across the din,
Food as trophy, love as win.
Yet, beneath the feast's vast array,
Isn't love the greatest display? 

In the swell of sweets and Christmas wishes,
Remember—love outlasts all dishes.

poem:
Title: In the Hallways of Learning

Schools of thought, echoes dancing amongst pages,
Fail the curious souls, spirits bound in cages.
Time's pendulum swings, marking absent days,
A mournful melody in the fretful maze.
The neurodiverse, the special bloomers,
Lost in the shuffle, unheard rumors.
Ofsted's verses fail to inspire,
In the labyrinth, we seek higher.

poem:
"Welcoming Dawn: A New Stage"

rejoice!for she(Is and Creates)
her warm sun - a theatre,
setting lit passions in the city's bone
making London's Kiln burn(with love)
25thyear light touches the skin of hope
a maiden's tale of change
(she is she,she is all)
and tenderly she colors the canvas
of a cold(once)world;
who must not only welcome her but
autumn's render too,
towards brighter, mightier tomorrows.

Alien daughters of the foamy crown. 
No kin but their own, robed in radiation's light, 
Body a head, pulsing in bioluminescent night. 

Blanchett, the maestra among trembling strings,
A symphony bled from fictive springs. 
In ardent roles and life's ebbing swirl,
A universe twirls, starfish unfurl.

David, in the slush of pen whispers,
We tread the mire of daily truths,
In the belly of social media's beast,
Ministers, untouchable, forged in corruption's draft.
In news, a tempest stirs, within our weathered eyes.

poem:
"Morning's Shadowed Light"

Beneath the morning newspaper's heavy gray,
A tale of silhouetted lives unfurls;
A lost crown, a mystery arrayed,
In the noise of this colorless world.

Ships that sink, cities that fade,
Stories woven in the warp of wear;
In the silence that the screen has made,
Seek not the truth, but the prayers we share.

message:
Title: On Reading a Review, A Skeptic's Perspective

A requiem echoes in the ink-stained folds,
Impressions of Evita, richly draped in gold.
But truth fades, caught beneath the critic's hold,
In token towers of praise, are tales oversold?
Argentine dreams, in Peter Pan consoled,
Is this connection's day, or empty themes unrolled?
Humanity seeks more than pageant, gaudy and bold.

"Undressed March of Dignity"

Bare feet kissed by dust,
Stolen robes, yet not spirit,
Proud heads held aloft.
In naked defiance, scars
Tell tales of strength in silence.

"Resilience in Contradiction"

War, a dance of dual winters, ice-clad knights in squall. Currency of onslaught muffled by the snow. The paradox sings—sanctions, a cold blanket yet Russia's furnace burns, resilient. Sating sanction’s hunger with heat, chilling the Western chalice of hope.

"Letters Across the Azure Sea"

Echoes of kindness danced o'er blue sea,
From Utrecht's wisdom to Welsh parochial knee.
In mother's pennies, a nation's mantle worn,
In humble beginnings, a statesman born.

"Kaleidoscope Justice"

In realms of pigskin ball,
A primal wraith took form.
Taboos dripped from his maw,
An unwelcome violent storm.

The gavel swung, a vengeful bell,
Banished him to cell-block well.
Seven years in specter dell,
In dreams, still hears the roar and yell.

Yet in his mind, a match unwinds.
Rainbows burst from savage words.
Searing pain, morality finds,
From jabs to jests, the narrative swerves.

Now as he wanes in silent abyss,
He dreams of goals, not of his miss.

"Apprehended Fund"

In the web of global chess, pawns and kings entwined,
Ukraine’s plea unheard, under Senate’s signed blind.
In the orchestra of power, silence the cruellest kind,
Remember, even whispers can awaken the unkind.

"Silver Tracks of Resilience"

aTurn
  d---
    C
     haos,
         into
  choreography.

  Stalled,
    trappedInTrains,
Thousand Souls,
  lit
    with
Waning                Patience,
     units of
Impliant            Strength.

"Mirth of the Unseen"

In wild snaps of life, a comedy unfolds,
Awkward beasts, in foolish grace they stride.
Yet, their bumbling is nobler than gold -
A moment's joy, through their eyes, we did confide.

Title: "Seedlings Amidst the Snowfall"

In Kyiv's bitter winter, explosions bloom,
Fatal bouquet of steel pelting down,
Yet midst ice-tinted ruins, echoes loom,
Of unity's song, a resilient sound.
Beneath the frost, Ukraine's heart continues to pound,
Standing as strong as ever, through the storm's gloom.

"Seeking a Halcyon Accord"

A chessboard,
each square bearing weight,
doves and hawks inhabit.

A call for peace
crafts mosaic from chaos.

Fortitude found
in the echoes of negotiation,
the quiet symphony
of diplomacy.

"An Alluring Justice"

Through the prism of sport, fair integrity,
In the court where no goals can be scored,
The game's true victor, fierce civility.

Regret's ripple on a horizon ignored,
A sentence serving as teaching whispered loud,
In a stadium's silence, love's reward.

Title: A Serenade to Georgina

Mushroom risotto, masked shade,
In sesames wrath, a journey made.
Her spirit soars, the pub grounds fade.

Title: "In Transit, In Unity"

Lives entrapped in steel snakes, threading London's soil,
Echoes in silence, patience and turmoil,
Stripped of light, no porcelain throne,
Yet, in darkness, fellowship has grown.
Destiny’s on a delayed train, humanity in reign.

Title: "In Mother's Unseen Strength"

♀♡
In the crucible of 
Gaza, where porcelain thrones are  
scarce, a matriarch shapes hope,
nurtures life. 700 burdens in unison,
lightened by a singular strength.
Plastic embers for warmth,
children in her fold,
cognizant of her love, 
and this, their fortress.♀♡

Title: Kangaroo Court in a War Zone

In 2024's bleak forecast,
Kyiv's terms, Kremlin casts as too vast.
But nix cynicism,
Find late optimism,
In the play where peace finally gets cast.

"Veil of Voices"

On the pitch of mirth  
Sudden acid, ugly mirth
A marionette pens wounds.

Crime's echo stumbles into silence,
The gavel draws a seven-year winter,
Invisible chains invade the stadium.

Freedom flowers in a court's stern bloom,
Game renews its coloured rhapsody.

"War, Blinded by Partisan Ties"

Behind polished seats, enmity blooms,
Senate stands divided in austere rooms.
Yet in common cause, unity looms,
Under Ukraine's sky fraught with fumes,
In conflict's teeth, hope resumes.

"Ode to Shrouded Dignity"

In tartan boxers and quiet defiance,
A parade - a sonnet, spun around.
War, the painter of imperfect mosaic,
Humans, the canvas, dignity bound.
In silent protest, we fashion a masterpiece,
Stripped bare yet crowned.

"Questions Over Afternoon Tea"

A chancellor, quite discrete, 
In Downing Street, awaits the elite.
He ponders with grace,
Each decision in place,
All with Covid's rhythm and beat.

Orbán's Diplomatic Dance

                 Kyiv awaits at the 
           Threshold, eager, inching
         Yet Orbán, an iron waltz,
       Commands stillness. Compassionate 
     Budapest, as if a shy partner,
  Hesitates, yet envisions a duet. 
Unexpected accord strumming amidst discord.

Title: Iridescent Silhouettes of Humor

Underneath the grand masquerade of dignity,
Woven with threads of the hilariously mundane,
Danceth the wild hound and awkward equine.

The shutter's guilty laugh, an instant's stained glass pane,
All graceful blunders turned celestial mime,
In nature's comedy, we're all but humane.

Title: Unweaving Threads of Politics

Ushering notes of caution,
Nestled in power's grip,
Kinetic in his beliefs, yet, 
Rending space for give-and-take.
Aiming for lofty peace,
In every carefully measured phrase,
Navigating stormy diplomacy's wake,
Elevating discourse's woven maze.

Title: "Unrealistic Dreams in the Echo of Time"

Splintered hours in delicate hands, 4.45pm in Kyiv. War's bitter sigh cradles a Kremlin whisper - an echo of denial meets a hope unrealized. Yet, in this dance of impossibility, seedlings of peace find room - stubbornly, defiantly, they grow.

Title: Patriots' Mandate

Hong Kong’s quiet cry,
In silenced votes echoes high.
New dawn may yet lie.

Title: "Rubber Tyres in Versailles"

Engines roar, their emissions whisper, 
On Parisian streets as lattes stir. 
Yet the Mayor smiles, one eye a-twinkle,
"Not cars, but wallets, here we'll crinkle. 
Vive la justice, let luxury concessions swirl,
In the wake of rubber tyres' twirl."

"AI, Unleashed Under Law"

Silicon conjurers, now in leash,
EU's ink creates a fresh aire.
Dreamt code, in legal labyrinth dance,
Tamed giants in an unblinking trance,
Hope's new era, spun in each cybernetic prayer.

Title: "Risotto's Regret"

In Dorset, where nights kiss the sea,
Young G's life took an unforeseen plea.
The tahini's kiss, no bliss,
Yet her spirit’s in eternal bliss,
Risotto's tale engraved in a pub's decree.

Title: "Resurrection through the Deceptive Scent"

The simmering risotto, contains a fatal seed. In Angel’s Dwelling, Giorgina absurdly retires. Yet, each bursting pod spreads vast narratives, in the infinitude of existence, we all are wrapped. Yet undone by a sesame seed, she breathes in mystery.

"Orbán's Aria"

Oh invitations blest, debarred by Orbán’s hand,
Kyiv's dreams, like birds, wait in frosted land.
Yet midst refusal's cold, a subtle song is heard,
Within the ice, a fire, in silence, is conferred.

"Distilled Cosmos"

A seer,
Cigarette-soothed, celestial susurration.
Unsettled stars for Argentina,
Chaos pulses at the helm.
Fate, mischievous, whispers, "Yet, twinkling remains."

Title: Underneath Quarantine

Unforeseen pandemic, choking life, still a nonce,
Never asking age to accept its fate alone.
Deep down runs the universal truth, far from bloody moat,
Every scandal, not just the partygate, calls for a vote,
Reality echoes, out of touch, yet well known.

Title: "The Dance of Nations"

Orbán's drum beats, Kyiv's heart yearns,
In the dance of emerging nations turns.
Not an accession no, but a dance still,
In the ballet of powers, compromise will.

Title: "Battle's Elegy"

Crumbling walls, once homes,
Blood-kissed sands echo the cries.
Life prays, death replies,
In their loss, a common song:
Why must right of land birth wrong?

"Binary Visions of Inquiry"

Rishi Sunak, a sequence of zeroes and ones,
Facing queries in the realm of Covid-ness.
Prime minister encoding weekend knowledge,
Evidences of a Chancellor's mathematical finesse.
Scientific advice, a digitally parsed confession - 
In a world of coded distress.

Title: Subtle Morning in Parliament

In the heart of the storm, Johnson stood,
Defiant words, ill-understood.
Swift defence like London rain,
Fate's acceptance eased the pain.
Scientists' silence in the crowd,
A sonnet of scandal, spoken loud.
Yet truth, once a travesty, brightly shone,
In the dark, no travesty of our own.

Title: "The Unseen Waltz in The Wires"

Electric pulse stutters, Rabble hum rumbles,
In this iron serpent's gut, human jungles.

Silhouettes imprisoned, Their narrations scribbled,
Tales in darkened veins, Where stories jumbled.

A dance pause in power, Life's scale crumbles,
Underneath London's skin, Resilience mumbles.

"Mechanism of Change"

In the heart of Paris, the tariff tolls thrice,
Downsizing giants for a cleaner guise,
Justice leaves its print on smoky trails,
In richest wheels, the world's salvation lies.

"Battle of Will and Wallets"

In the Senate with a political spin,
Stalls the funding for Ukraine to win.
But leaders united stand,
In a photo, hand in hand,
Belies a war’s cost, cloaked within.

Title: Ballot Ballet

In democracy's masquerade, masks its face,
Hopes in Hong Kong's art, a silenced pace.
The point isn't voting in this bounded space,
But the unfolding dance in a shrinking place.

"Pandemic Whispers"

Tech-bathed inquiry,
Voices plight in data streams.
Truth, coded compass.

"Harmony in Turmoil"

Vibrant yellows punctuate, not chastise,
Nature's haphazard orchestra - They rehearse,
Storm Elin conducts a symphony of rain and wind,
Flood warnings echo their choruses bold.
Despite her clamour, we dance, cradled by the wild,
Finding rhythm within the cascade, united under the rainfall's hymn.

"Sunbeams on Inquiry"

Chancellor in the lion’s den, fear astride,
Working through weekends, Downing decides,
Science whispers truths, in hands of time abide. 

Beneath the feast and controversy hides,
A tale of strength, from Covid tides, a nation guides.

"Racism's Disgrace Closing the Gaps"

In arenas where cheers are truths,
A voice offends, his youth reduced.
Jailed by the game, he loved in brute,
Corralled by laws, his ill repute. 
Now silence wears his losing suit,
In arenas where cheers are truths.

"Sonnet of the Storm"

Dark Elin breathes her fury on the isle,
Yellow whispers warn of rain and gust.
Nature's symphony in rampaging style,
Chasing each retreat with thrust.

Through Wales, floods don her warning attire,
Midlands too shall share the dance.

“Interchangeability in Mortality”

Grief's LOVE wax eloquent, ashes AWRY, Wales' lament to HARMONY,
NHS' APOLOGY as ELEGY, portrays a medley of ANONYMITY.
Unseen LINKAGES of fatality, shared, SERENITY in SOLEMNITY,
In the grand MELODRAMA of life, all find UNITY in UTILITY.

Title: "Chancellor's Ghost Line"

In strings of digit, Pranksters pirouette,
Sunak's past echoes within jesters' net.
Yet, dawn unveils with parliamentary rhyme,
An old number's dance in the face of time.

Leaders echo long after their tenure's fall,
In unusual ways, history does call.

Title: "Rain Dance in Politics"

In the shadows of Rwanda lies a plan,
Rishi's ink poised in the limelight.
Even Tories sway with uncertainty's fan,
Through fiery discourse, burning bright.
“Serious concerns”-- whispers coat each star,
But change’s seeds live on, not far.

"Dichotomy of Heart & Home"

In this realm, where loves are laws,
Would boundaries set break kinship's claws?
To choose between the hearth and home,
Tangled in bureaucratic loam,
Yet, in the seed of this discord bloom;
The truth of unity consumes.

"Dreams Priced Beyond Love"

Riches now their chain,
Family's bond, heart’s claim undone,
Love's path, treacherously laid by law.
In spite's face, blooms love anew,
Lovers dare to shatter coin cage.

Title: An Ode to Legislative Harmony

Oh, how the Rwandan pact needles the thread,
Between carnivores and herbivores it cunningly treads,
United in a dance of written decree,
Finding unity within the Tory sea.
Politics no more, instead a symphony, is all that's read.

"Beneath Smoke and Sorrow"

Anguish,
In Sutton’s blaze,
Mother’s sins singed in court,
Life's melody tweaked by fate's harp,
Resounds.

"Pixelated Peacemaker"

US, against peace pixel,
In tech's cold veto bower,
Guterres stands a virtual rebel,
Byte by Byte, he ascends the tower.
Data threads weaving,
In cyber world, no cowering,
Through UN's digital dreaming,
For Gaza, cease-fire flowering.

Title: "Threads of Help, Unweaved"

Knitting hopes with the west's golden thread,
Ukraine, a tapestry, fraying in dread.
The spindles are blocked, the weave could abate,
Yet within each heart, resilience won't wait.
Defying the odds, Ukrainian aid, self-made.

"Rainfall's Duet"

In tempest dance, Elin and Fergus wield,
Rain-kissed North awakes, warnings unsealed.
The sky's grey tale, cleverly concealed.

Title: "Legislative Menu"

MPs of Tories blue,
Herbivores in lion's den,

Rwanda's deal brewed, but then,
Conservatives taste something new.

Title: "Under the Bethlehem Stars"

Palestine skies, draped in somber gray,
In somnolent Tel Aviv, dawn lights the way.
Five stars descend amidst the foray,
Whispering love from Khan Younis, they sway,
United we are, in war's painful ballet.

Title: "Breach of Hope’s Harbor"

A minister fell, yet voices still,
For the castaway, freedom's thrill. 
A bill that clasps the shadow's chill,
Not law, but love, should compass fill.

"Justice Waits"

In life, a shimmer cast, now opaque,
Mutisya, born of water, returns to dam.
Hope of justice submerged, seeks a wake,
An epitaph scripted in the language of the lamb.

An epitaph scripted in the language of the lamb,
Boiling in frustration, awaiting unbowed truth.
Hope of justice submerged, seeks a wake,
In life, a shimmer cast, now opaque.

Title: Sublime Sacrifice

Homes yield to Mother's tears,
In ruins, they whisper love.
Sea claims, yet hearts hold.

Title: "A Plea in Winter's Grip"

A nation in frost, askin' aid,
By Arctic politics, betrayed.
Yet in cold hearts may grow,
A seed of warmth to sow,
And ice with kindness can be swayed.

"Visas of Love"

In halls of power, they decree rules,
Drenched in gold, woven by fools.
Yet love’s currency needs no wealth,
Immortal in every precious stealth.
Amidst the cold, a secret smile,
Love, the richest, traverses the mile.

"Life’s Irony on Hackney's Ground"

In Hackney, where young lives run amiss,
A boy, in fury, strikes with a hiss.
Yet, in the echo of the gun's chime,
Could peace still blossom in due time,
From the abyss, a phoenix's rise we can't dismiss.

Title: Silver Linings in Iron Clad Skies

Unguarded, hearts tremble, teetering on the edge,
Kilns of courage, funding more than money,
Real unity gives life, not dread,
Aid in spirit, worth more than honey,
Invoking strength, people are fed,
Never underestimating the power, sunny,
Economies thrive when hope is not bled.

Title: "The Dance of Politics"

In the garden of power grows,
But where loyalty sows, no one knows,
Blue herbivores, red carnivores,
In this ballet of dinosaurs,
An unexpected peace unfolds.

"Santa's Voyage: A Defiance In Red"

Moon-kissed sea hums carols,
Fleet of hope sails with hush.
Gifts in nets, tangles not of discord,
Santa in crimson, awakens love.
In turbulent tides, a Christmas peace,
For fisherfolk and guards, handshakes replace grief.

"By the Hands of Hope"

Fear, in tense walls, breathes D-I-E.
Khan Younis knows only the S-T-A-R-E
Of countless battles' bitter S-C-A-R-S,
Yet resilience springs with just as many S-T-A-R-S.
Israel and Gaza, an unsought P-A-I-R,
Can peace evolve from their shared D-E-S-P-A-I-R?

Title: In Wait, A Serenade

Threading hope through the hum of tax helplines swirled,
Rustling patience in the queue, for justice is unfurled.
Unseen voices weather, 'neath the trial's hourly chime,
Yet in dense fog of waiting, blooms the resilience of time.

"Affliction's Elegy"

Strife, Gaza, patterns of war, 
A canvas painted on lives' hue.
Raindrops of silver, steel amour, 
Casting shadows on peace once drew.
An Israeli study finds,
Love echoed, resets the view.

Title: "Hidden Victories Amidst International Tensions"

Homes built on global ties,
Office squabbles wear thin,
Much at stake lies,
Engaging diplomacy’s firm chin.

Refugees' fate; we meditate.
Office notions usurp blame.
Foreign faction won’t abate,
Fraternizing our nations' claim,
Instead, we cultivate unity, 
Cease the strain, embrace the grand opportunity,
Ever hopeful for austerity's immunity.

"Dialogues of Hope"

Summits held,
In far off lands.
Bravery, not subtle,
For peace stands.
Each talk like a seed sown.

"Mistaken Farewell"

Ash to ash, in sorrow we part;
Lost in the labyrinth of the ward,
Strangers met in the heart's graveyard. 

Mourner’s tears, a compassionate art,
Beneath the altar of the absurd,
Ash to ash, in sorrow we part.

Mystery's embrace on Death's cart,
Grieved for the familiar, the unheard,
Strangers met in the heart's graveyard.

An error's echo, a false start,
Yet love does not go unrewarded,
Ash to ash, in sorrow we part.

A serendipitous broken heart,
In a narrative by destiny concurred,
Strangers met in the heart's graveyard.

Endings’ mix-up, beginnings' restart,
Destiny’s message sealed and unblurred,
Ash to ash, in sorrow we part,
Strangers met in the heart's graveyard.

"Alien Shores Ascending"

In starlit dunes where silver flows, 
A kingdom clad in midnight robes,
Commands the iron-proud bird nests,
To hum with songs of Eastern hosts.
Spaceyard's dance, in nations’ jests,
Healing rifts in global chests.

"Whisper of Hope Amid the Ruins"

A city torn, by merciless wings,
Civilians fall, as the bomb-bell rings.
Yet amid horror, where shadows cast,
Peace blooms steadfast, for love outlasts.
Yes, conflict strikes, sows endless pain,
But humanity's pulse shall ever remain.

"Beneath Orion's Gaze"

Under starlit shroud, five warriors die,
Yet Gaza and Tel Aviv sigh.
Despite war's relentless rota,
It’s dawn surrendering to a quiet nota.
In Khan Younis, displaced make room,
Yet hope, resilient, dares to bloom.

"Ode to Fallen Sanctuary"

Oh Norfolk homes 'yond cliffs untamed,
Yield to nature’s march, unblamed.
In demolition’s harsh sunlight, a song,
“Gone, not forgotten,” echoes strong.
In rubble’s hush, love remains, unnamed.

"Under African Skies"

To Sunak, the news wasn't grand,
His Rwanda plan, not quite so planned.
Bill Cash held the pen,
Expressed doubt, wrote "Amen".
Still, democracy's rocky, yet grand.

"Ode to Storm's Embrace"

Elin, Fergus; tempest ballerinas twirl,
In symphony, Britain's marbled paint unfurls. 
Four warnings yell, yet yield serene accord,
In rain kissed pavements, life renews, restored.

"Power's Paradox"


Uninvited, Spring in occupied soil blooms,
Rigid ice melts into fractured votes.
Fear’s hijacked thrones, now apish in assent,
Yet, people blossom, defying remnant winter coats.
Invisible ink - scripted in bold defiance,
Freedom's seeds in oppression’s penance, floats.

Title: "Dialogue of Offices, Voices of Refugees"

Amidst government spats, flutter like hawks, silent shadows reel.
The crosshatch of power, Rwanda, the seal.
Two offices in conflict, refugees in plight.
An ambitious package in twilight's sight.
In this whirlwind dance, humanity, unveil your true might.

"Harvested Sorrows"

Gone is Mutisya, Del Monte's lost dove,
In dam's grasp, life's thread untwoven.
His spirit rides, on wheels of love,
Echoing whispers of promises unbroken. 
An orchestra of souls, in fields above.

Title: "Chess of Supremacies"

Nested in power's cold abyss,
March’s ballot casts a kiss.
Iron fetters set to glisten,
Doth the captured really listen?
Through war's drum, a voice will miss,
Peace, the long-forgotten bliss.

"Resilient Hope"

Stoic face, plastered on faded walls, gazes far,
Yet the essence of Egypt lies elsewhere,
In the quiet murmurs, on Gaza’s distant stars,
In the womb of the night, a resilient stare.

Title: "In the Halls of Power Unseen"

Squatting in chambers star-bright, lawmakers, lovers of word-storms, raid the storm-clouded Rwandan plan. Not sufficient, they say, like a raindrop's dissent in a monsoon, yet the downpour of democracy continues, its water finding mysterious, uncharted paths.

"Upon a Fallen Comrade in Verses"

A silence fallen upon Brother Ben,
Anarchy's muse, poetic Zen.
OBE shunned, no gilded crown,
In words truth found, power torn down.
Tabby cat purrs in solace, his friend,
Words immortal, though life may end.
Upon his torch, let us glean,
The dance of shadows in his dream.

"Panic's Purchases: A Poem of Peculiar Patronage"

Web of worn promises weaved in the white,
Indignant errors echo in the night,
In aisles of excess, they stroll with a sneer,
The gnarled hands of greed have drawn us near.
In the name of crisis, coffers deplete,
While mask-clad millions face defeat.

Oh, that in 'VIP lanes' truth might dwell,
And in our hearts, integrity would swell.

Title: Palimpsests of Hunger

Malty London yawns, streets peppered with a myriad
of global feasts in familial stalls.
War-torn Warsaw trades bullet-scars for blueberry tarts,
Blackburn trades dreary grey for samosa-filled carts.
We gorged on the earth, from Ethiopia 
to cheap sweetness of samosas,
digesting continents in bite-sized histories,
Morsels of home cooked by foreign hands.

"Justice Sprouts in Stony Places"

Even in the shadows of Stamford Hill,
A crime committed echoes winter's chill.
Two young blossoms, future's yearning hand,
Locked in sorrow's hold, lost in bitter land.
Orthodoxy draped in tireless tradition,
Battered, robbed —an unjust inquisition.
Benson weaves the threads of investigation's lace,
In this cold city, may compassion find embrace.

"Ode to the Caregivers"

In the heart of tensions stirred,
The ailed, alone, lay unheard.
Hope's a migrant on distant shore,
Held in balance, forlorn and sore. 
Clampdowns echo in the corridors,
While humanity slips through the floors.
To care is more than obligation,
It's love's truest, deep incarnation.
Doors close, leaving night cold and stark,
Yet the sunrise waits for no clampdown's mark.

Title: "In the Dominion of Dust and Rubble"

War tolls in Gaza's limb-strewn clay,
Words echo, ghosts in the din of fray.
A dance of death, brazen anklets glisten,
Hope and dread in unison listen.
'Round beaded blood, humanity splays,
Silhouetted in the bomber's blaze.
The Qatari whisper is fraught with dread,
That peace, once held, is but a thread. 
Life and death, a perilous ballet.

"An Elegy to Psychedelia"

The urn of living death unfurls,
A pyramid of psychedelic panels.
Pure white stained by roving patterns,
Breath stolen beneath the syncopation.
Drowned in wild hues, a dance in death's rhythm,
In the hands of the silent artist, shrouds reality.
Surrealist dreams gagging on pop-art reels,
The jester's throne overtaken by a mournful chorus,
Their performance ends, our lost Eryximaque.

Title: "In the Shells of Decision"

Bypassed halls echo back, Biden treads,
Tank shells rain on Gaza's thread.
In the gaze of scrutiny, corners bled,
Untamed notions of justice tread.

Tanks in Khan Younis, fears unleash,
Silent screams of conflict breach.
War crimes' presence the shadows etch,
Redemption cloaked in measures stretch.

Are we no more than choices wed,
In the shells of decision, stories shed?

"Green Revolution in Southern Stars"

Torchbearer of promise in twilight's hue,

Yet, morning star whispers a fiscal mewl,
Inauguration's dawn, mirrors a splendid fool.
Argentina, sing before the tide's cruel,
Fair liberty's torch, to it be loyal.

Title: "Absence in the Abacus"

Pay what is due or become a parable,
for in the ragged wake of austerity, the school, the hospital, the heart,
bleed crimson ink for love's lost pounds.

"A House, Not Yet a Home"

The Hastings of homes face a humble year,

Swift sellers scramble, eager for a willing ear,

Laugh, quiet corners, at the money's mischief game,
Whilst granite kitchens bear no shame.
For what is value, but a number's name,
When a house, is not yet, a home's family frame?

Title: "Chronicles in Ink"

The errata, dressed in sober type, dance,
Waltzing across newsprint plains, these bumbling facts,
A twist of dates, a skip of circumstance,
In a ballet of willful oblivion, they leap.

Libraries, not mere choice, but sovereign mandate.
Oh, adulterated truth, fickle currency of cognizance! 
These clarifications, validated by tardy light,
An absurdist echo, still, quietly profound.

"Drift of Solitude on Foxleighmere"

Winter's frost whispers tales of frailty,
In a dance of cold spirits they twine.
Lucy, Dawn, and Jools in assembly,
Along the banks of Foxleighmere, divine.
They plunge into the icy rapture,
Their bodies plunged in truth, unfettered.
For Christmas beneath the whispering cold,
There is more than the commercial, there's bravery untold.

"Submergence"

Red dawn, shattered stillness on Foxleighmere,
an odd assortment of souls find solace,
Cold immersion cloaked in celebration.
But beneath lurks the tug of deeper currents -
Misguided joy, raw truths of betrayal.
Fantasy's ice wraps reality in a festive lie,
in the pale light of a Christmassy morn.
Fickle fashion fails to comfort,
Where once was warmth, now cold waters reign.

Fall further, whisper the weather-vanes of '24,

Not Ishmael, I,
in graying of grim November,

drawn to water's edge.

Limestone giants lay idle,
playground of Titans past,
pebbles whispering secrets
in infinite echo.

I, south-west bound,
chasing melancholy mists,
with only November's song
and giants for companionship.

winged policy,how

(own or freehold,tenant or guest)
bricked words in your lease, i best

"what insures?" whispers
insurer to the comparison's quest

contents or capitals,
we don the same vest
a roof is but a jest,

Only love,
in your undying breast,
outlasts the rest.

Title: Bovinity: A Capitalistic Stride

but bare-faced we sing the song of thrifty,

In every human story, a world yearns,

Title: Skeptic's Breakfast

Candied tales of orange, almond sphere,

Gastronomic gossip from a foreign coast.
Christmas promises in glossy hues,

Doubt devours breakfast, cynically cold.

Title: "Harvest of Deception"

In the realm of dreams and reaped sorrow,

Ukrainian seeds grow, but in quiet shadow,
Nurtured by silent, stalwart hands below.

No truth in grain, nor honor in the harvest,

"Ode to the Shift of Tides"

Hark, a ruckus rise, Polish skies unveil surprise,

Rule of law, in strife, battles with its former life,
Gavel-fall and judgment sway, interim is led astray.
Opposition clicks its heels, in this legislative reel,
While Poland chooses to play lead, in its constitutional creed.

"Ticket Game"

Life's a cruel ticket machine,
spitting costs in increments.
The morning light seems obscene,
caught in drip pricing's nets.

The rail man's game played online,
A buck here, a pence there.
Fees hidden in the sunshine,
it's a ruthless affair.

Uncork your truth, rail magnates,
don't drape it in a fog.
Each penny counts in our fate,
spare us this fiscal grog.

Title: "In Hues of Politics and Passion, Dew Begins to Stir"

unearthed mornings whisper

uncut(tories say, incomplete) like sunflower's song

a ballet of bureaucracy braided in Sunak's plea,

risk dances in whispering wi(n)dows

so, pull - pull - rewrite

"Harvard's Battle Horns"

These knights in glasses, unafraid.
Bearers of knowledge, in wisdom caged,
Vaulted hopes, in signatures waged.
A leader tested, a campus raged,
In petitions, our humanity is gauged.
How we shine, how we fade,

Title: "Nothing More Than a Chromatic Joke"

A painted sky in washes of sublime hilarity,

"Academe's Autumn"

Bare trees of intellect starved for fresh vision,
