Upon the railing of new legislation,
Hangs a cold wind, in clandestine disguise.
Grey clouds, a portent of academy's corrosion,
Over halls of knowledge, an iron curtain lies,
A flood of wisdom drained by silent erosion,
In the marrow of progress, the future dies.

Title: Apology in Empty Spaces

In a world stricken silent by sorrow's hand,
An apology floats, a feather in a hurricane.
Defence to an offense unwilled, yet grand,
Echoes in empty halls and hearts of pain.
Through the swirl of loss, a lesson we demand,
How life slips away, like desert sand.
In remorse's shadow, understanding we gain,
A candle flickers, hope remains.

Title: Dawn Over Warsaw 

Chased away, the night's oppressive cloud,
Dark years of division, fear aloud.
In parliament's firm vote, a hope new found,
Poland's heart beats in Tusk's sacred sound.
For native sons and daughters, he is vowed,
To erase the charcoal lines that crowd.
Thanks to Poland's spirit, proud and unbowed,
Emerges day, with joyous light endowed.

Title: On Harvest of Consequences 

In the vortex of law's relentless mill,
One tiny man does wail; Giuliani,
Shorn of his sheaves, beset by winter's chill.
Circle of reward, circling uncanny.
The hawks of justice on their arc descend,
Mock-hymn the cry of dwindling capacity.
See the requiem of reputation's end,
A death by shards of financial paucity.

Title: "Apologia in the Mist of a Pandemic"

Pity Sunak, sombre in his crow's robes,
Apologies pulsed through marrow of bitten tongue,
Speaking sorrow for a lost multitude.
"The contagion claimed, we did but strive to aid."
Feast or famine, a nation bellows between bites,
Yet chokes on the crumbs of 'eat out, help out.'
Prime helm, guide us or erode in guilt's tide.

Title: "Unwatery Eyes of the Law"

AI seeks to surveil, to see,
Our identities as data's decree,
But righteous EU in wisdom's measure,
Hides us from the technologic treasure.
Through circuits' glow and silicon sigh,
The truth is twisted, the innocent lie.
Policing breath, by code adjudicate,
Our freedom sold, or merely late?
Power's temper tantrums, controlled,
Today's world, profoundly patrolled.

"Consequences in the Morning Light"

Bleak Farage from TV spews,
Stirs sunken Tories in their pews,
Seemingly set for Sunak's loss,
In this relentless political toss.
Yet, I find solace in the morn,
Despite headlines that scorn,
For tides do rise and fall, indeed,
In the garden of political seed. 
Though certain today seems grim,
A new tomorrow may begin.

Title: "Lessons We Think We Understand"

These gray rooms where thoughts spin in circles,
brief bursts of colour crushed by formal black and white.
Academic echoes reverberate, a coded Morse,
leeching life from learning's vibrant pulse.
Examined understanding in rote-walked rhythms,
yet minds yearn to wander where wisdom freely roams.
Reform's urgent plea, an untapped song,
waiting for hearts courageous enough to sing.

Title: "AI's Grip Unfurling"

In Union's hallowed precincts bound, AI's stare 
curbed by law's impervious glare. 
Three days' dance bore an edict fair,
Silent threats in pixel layers laid bare. 

Yet judgement waits on ink-stained script, 
Officials' whispers possibilities, tightly gripped.
Monday's dawn new revelations eclipse, 
In real-time pulse, truth's balance tips.

"A Celebration of Flesh, A Constellation of Desire"

Strip off illusions, each bare creature sings,
Under the British spotlight's insistent glare.
A jamboree of souls on gossamer wings,
Their nakedness a cause donned out of care.
In the cascade of laughter, a holler of fright,
Beyond the curtain, they confront fragility's plight.
Beneath the December chill, they ignite -
A paradoxical warmth on this Christmas night.

"Earth's Late Entry Dancers"

Knotted cynics in the ballroom of belief,
nooses of denial swing perfunctory, preordained.
Obsidian shadows given carte blanche to breach
the sacristy of hope, access unrestrained.
Sure, let scepticism seed the conference core,
but tie it tight to truth, not hidden spin.
Harvest the metic's fact for a thirsty floor,
and salt the sowing of the corporate sin.

Title: On 'Day 657'

In the ornate frame of dawn,
Zelenskiy flies, a question half-spoken,
To lands of gilt-promise and conceded wrongs.
A play written in dollar bills and distant buildings,
As Kyiv whispers in cold steel echoes.
Biden awaits across the sea,
In the house of mirrored speeches,
Where day 657 curls beneath the Senate's solemn tongue.

"From My Bedroom, Hearing Of War"

Through gauze of morning haze, another's plight, 
An alien gaze on Gaza's dim light. 
Sanctions echo, yet lay bare
The hollowness of ancient despair. 
Yet in the sleepless quiet, alone, 
Parade the pockets of resistance known. 

Wars' cruel pattern traced once more,
The same, yet not as those before.
Bitter echoes, distant chats,
This bed, these words, the world, like that.

Title: Quantum Bird Plucked Bare

Sun-drunk robin with eyes of quantum mysteries,
choked out tales painted in nursery rhymes.
'Ain't for us to mind,
just a fly's eye recital of death.
Who grieves for Cock Robin? Not me. 
Find honor, maybe, 
in the small, pitiful surrender
of a bird with just enough courage
to fall from a goddamn tree.

Title: "In the Land of Analog"

Bank card sought amidst the clutter,
In the M6's mechanical mutter. 
Digital ghosts laughing in disdain,
At the forgotten dance of our physical mane. 
Cheshire retreat, an unplugged soiree,
Humankind in mechanical ballet.
Laughs at this twirling, fumbling ballet:
How comical, this ancient Way.

Title: Emancipation from the Digital Chain 

Oh rejoice, a respite from the digital beast,
Unplugged in Cheshire, where silence is a feast.
Echoes of old, a card in hand,
Where progress meets the timeless sand.
Rummaging through the scattered past,
For a moment, life without a cast.
Rise, oh soul, in this tollbooth stance,
Breathe the fragrance of a tech-less dance.

Title: "At The Threshold Of Dawn And Democracy"

Whispers slide, muted as shadows depart from No 10.
Sunken battles mar Sunak's reflection in Rwanda's tear.
90 voices stand tall in the stillborn morn',
Against this bill of silence, their cry is clear.
Immoral. Unlawful. The echoes shatter the norm.
Yet, the home secretary arrives, in indifference' sphere.
In broken hours, the struggle to transform.

"Reverie of Blue Lights"

In the years of yesterday, pixelated dreams,
Akin to opaque sapphire strung in the evening, unfold.
Corrupt constables, our intrigue charmed in its spectre.
Shadows dancing on the walls of consciousness,
Missteps in cobalt dramas, daringly fresh.
Was the parody self, were the lines duty-bound,
Or does the story find itself in the telling?

"Upon The Absent Minister's Flight"

The Minister's chair, oh empty fight,
In the throes of a warming plight.
Fury called, but he just slipped,
Now each brittle leaf is chipped.
Dylan's eyes in sleepless grief,
Witness not the fallen leaf.
Shadows dark on conference chart,
For the Minister hence departs.
Oh, take heed, you sleepy seers,
Of our earth in heated tears.

Title: "Parliamentary Parable"

Brown, old weary soldier, blames the farce,
Painting truth with ink, all opaque and sparse.
Yet we, hailing from quiet strife,
Watch the cautious end of his political life.
Unforgiving gears of human contraption,
Force resignation, survival's reaction.
Now silenced within the Chamber's discourse,
He ponders - illusion of power, remorse.

Title: The Dance of Numbers 

In the quiet theatre of morning,
newsprint lays bare our trite dances –
a ballet of currencies, economic whisperings.
Inheritance of percentages, vacant as love unreturned.
3.1%, a slightest rise, a gesture to the gods of shelter,
core inflation asserts its efforts; yet,
Peak rates stand, unscathed in the looming narrative,
Predictions are no balm—numbers, harsh lovers of certainty.

Title: "The Rainbow Stand"

Wrapped in dappled fear, as day leaks light,
Staszewski stakes his claim, painted bright.
Clasping colors twined, oppressors' blight,
He stands against the gale, a rainbow kite.

Speak Tusk, echoing through hallowed hall,
Beyond borders, decode bigotry's scrawl.
Tonight, the ballot holds them all,
Anxious, in their woeful enthral.
  
Gay, Polish, maker of proud flight,
Embrace your kind, abolish spite.

Title: "In Protest of Condemnation Missed"

Three wise presidents, perched in the nest,
Their words caught in a tempest mess.
Each choosing sides, or so it seems,
In the hallowed halls of academic dreams.
Oh, Claudine Gay, you'll stay, they say,
While antisemitism's shadow, two others sway.
In the grand charade of higher thought,
What lesson, truly, have these leaders taught?

"From Prosperity's Cloak, Shadows Drawn"

In vessels of power, corruption's no surprise,
Each moral seam rips under wealth's weight,
Mone, ensnared in law's unblinking eyes,
A dance of deceit on government's plate.
PPE Medpro, whispers of bribes,
Not in markets or alleys, but in silent scribe.
In this opulent masquerade we awake,
To find honor and richness the hardest handshake.

"Justice caught in the Throat of Irony"

Two palates meet, the bitter and the gold,
Starvation's price, in cruel echo told.
Solitude's cell, a deathly feast weighed,
In scales of justice, sorrow's counter-shade.
Tokens exchange in hollow halls, a jest
For life's scant breath, now silent in the west.
Compensation cries from an empty plate-
In the grand theatre of irony, we await.

"A Desperate Sonata"

An echo, pancreatic, within Texas bounds -
The pivot and swivel, Kate Cox raveled unwound.
Sired children, petaled futures in her womb's key,
A lifeline unlatched for discretion's decree.
In court-ruled tumult, she sought another town,
Her courage, a hymn, in the sad newsprint's frown.

Title: "Water's Debt - A Cry from the River's Edge"

Tears, by the murky Thames, wept by craven crows,
Misnamed, a shambles, for sterling liquid owed.
Opaque tales of equity painted in dusky rose,
Truth, like water, in sullied linens stowed. 
Byrne cries for us, "The nation's heart doth bleed,
Embittered fruits of greed, sown by duplicitous seed".

Title: "In the Shifting Cubicle of Time"

In the sterile cubicle, smiling turned sour,
A promotion perceived, but instead an eclipse.
The city's hum fades to a Giuliani whisper,
Unravelling truth, minting fresh treacherous lips.
Life's reel spun backwards, unasked, unsought,
A day stitched in chaos and journalistic blight.
Yet, resilience lies coiled in an innocent thought,
An election worker's wrong, decidedly will make right.

"A Memory of Yuletide Giving"

Once we wept for joy, dear children,
In the warmth of Christmas glow,
Under Edmonds' heartfelt giving,
As Noel gifts would flow. 

Wheels for those whose hearts were burdened,
Toys for hands that worked not played,
Love in parcels, wrapped and ribboned,
Kindness in each choice he made.

Touched by truth of humble deserving,
In the Dog House, teardrops stayed.

Title: "A Jest of Power"

Tories in their folly, jesters on the stage, 
A tragicomedy of honour, the die of age.
Of principles, a void, of government, a farce,
A mirror of deceit, each act more perverse.
Yet, the masses prop them high, their hollow charade.
Survival is the play, in truth's grand masquerade. 
Rwanda's bill, a spectre, upon their painted face,
A comical disgrace.

"Pathetic Fallacy in British Rain"
 
Sunak, you navigate politics as one navigates storm,
Dragging Rwanda's name through a bottle-necked parliament.
In the sigh of ministers, echoes of unkept promises hum,
while the sky's dismal tints speak tales of more than weather.
Painted grey like the uncertain road ahead,
Promise of progress wanes, yet, the house unhesitatingly nods.
Remember, dear Rishi, there's more to a name than its whisper.

"Ode to the Electric Beast"

Bold green cat, stirs upon British tarmac,
A coiled Jaguar, silent in its pride.
Roaring without fire, a hybrid stride,
Wheels spun by phantom stallions at her back.
Ghosts of combustion lingering in her rack,
'Revolution!' engines no longer hide.
Dawn breaks with whispers, a stealthy ride,
Future's nostalgic love letter, sealed in electric black.

"Threads of Hope in the Tapestry of Strife"

658 dawns, burdened yet brave,
An echo of war, ring loud in the deafening silence.
In the waltz of power, a plead and resistance,
A warning laced with a choice and a chance.
Under the world's watchful, wondering eye,
Hold fast, Ukraine, in your hopeful dance.
Though the rhythm falters, faith must not wane,
For every sunrise stirs today's defiance.

Title: In the Shadow of the Unspoken

Lives roil in the brew of politick,
Cash injections for an age-old sick,
But all the king's horses, all the king's men,
Shuffle their feet, start anew again.
A war framed in paragraphs thin,
Beneath quiet murmurs, a thunderous din.
Is this really what has been learned?
The pages of history once more turned.

Title: An Elegy for Skyward Dreams

In Lilydale, two hearts lay still –
a man, a boy, in crumpled steel.
Homemade wings clipped power's thread, 
where blue skies swallowed hopes, now dead.

A silent river bears their tale,
As shadows fill where sunlight paled.
Through woven grief, the clouds conceive
Two stars that left, too soon to grieve.

Title: "The Parable of Parrot Table Manners"

Cockatoos dunk their crusts in tea,
Like old aunt Gladys, just past three.
Men in white coats scribble 'revealing',
And nature woos with dunking feeling.
In every seed and sullen cracker,
Drips the mystery of the snacker,
Drenched, the banquet sings anew,
We're all alike - me, you, cockatoo.

Title: "An Unfinished Journey"

In waters did the lost one stray.
Where whispers tell of Norwich's day.
Missing, no sight - in dismay.
Gaynor's path, in currents held sway.

Belongings stay, memories fray,
From city centre to Wensum's bay.
A tale of tears in the clay,
The river owns her ballet.

Mother, worker, heart's mainstay,
In water's arms, she finds her way.

Title: "A Single Stroke"

In the morning fold of a Japanese newspaper,
Kanji for "tax" ascends to the throne of the year.
A symbol gaining weight in its own silence, 
reflecting the winter of discontent.
Yet, in the sharp black ink of 'zei,' 
the head priest finds beauty.
In the dance of his brush under Kyoto's morning dews,
Abacus beads shiver in anticipation.

Title: "Physician or Associate, Quite the State"

Laughter chases confusion, dances in dusk,
Physician associates, in trust we must.
Misunderstood they might be,
In NHS, a rarity.
Ten thousand strong, a plan, a fuss,
To fill our gaps, without a cuss.
Yet in their roles, we often thrust,
The title doctors don us trust!

"Highland Portraits on a Sleet-scathed Screen"

In the seasoned heart of Dunblane, shortcake mythology,
A distaff tale of Berry and Murray's ancestry.
Catch the fading shimmer of Highland tapestry,
In the kitchen's clatter and reindeer's vanity.
Stolen moments, hearth-warmed and hearty,
Unveiled by a granny's hands, stolid yet arty.
Tasting the pie, shortbread's aura, the bûche's history,
Televised lives, shaped by Scotland's mystery.

Title: Monstrous Motifs

A parade of sardonic shadows large,
Godzilla's rage in a cinematograph,
Bazillions of stories, where creatures barge, 
An ironic ode to the behemoth's chafe. 
In the palm of illusory might,
The narrative thread, in a seamstress' stitch,
Unwinds tales of an omni-chromatic fight,
Scripting chronicles on celluloid's rich ditch.
Their reflections, in our conscience switch,
A metaphor for our nature amiss.

"Today's Promise Illuminated in Tomorrow's Ash"

Summer heat scorches promises,
Man's willed opening of hell's gates,
Guterres hails the belated chorus.
Two weeks of negotiating fates.
Fossil fuels, in final adieu,
Yet, my faith is circumspect,
Is the sky less mournful, less blue?
Is the earth's wound swiftly correct?
Hope, a fickle sunbeam,
In the shadow of climate's regret.

Title: "When Freedom is Subdued"

Where amongst birds does a voice remain caged,
Against the reign of clouds, lines repressed?
An activist named Ice, now disengaged,
In the prison's cold their truths undressed.
A night in Bangkok, rights aborted,
The poem of justice distorted.
Let the ink of passion not wane,
Each word a candle against the disdain.

"Unseen Symphony"

Therein shadows twang, twin notes divorce,
One in fervor's crescendo, another retreating.
An atlas of loss drafted in slow Morse,
On the distant music of Quakes' repeating.
Extraordinary siblings, one voice now gone,
Can the echo of his notes find solace in the dawn? 
To teach English, or decode the tongue of grief,
In silence, we find relief.

Title: "A Route of Echoed Raptures"

(eye travelled, as joy'd sprouted wing)
saw: a dance of ancient hues(a dream-woven tapestry of time)
mildewed museum walls- breathed Art, 
and rewove heart's rhythm divine.
(tapestry, painting, novel bound 
found: sea's un-caught Muse
and sky's uncaged Sound)

though maps may sleep, or borders fade
art's odyssey un-ends, only blooms-
each cultural heart-way becomes unmade.
(chasing lofted echoes inside hallowed tombs)

"Breath of Discord"

In the cold cathedral of policy,
Orbán's voice rings obstinate and true,
Defying whispers of unity.
While in the Polish Hall of stately hue,
A lone extinguisher sputters out borrowed light,
Unwilling to honour the Hanukkah rite.
Interference garbs itself in morning's dew,
These quiet acts of dissolution hew.

"Murmurations in Gaza"

Pain echoes in the rain-soaked cobbles of Shejaiya,
Nine souls sifted out by rage's thunder.
Under a sky churning with dark laughter, 
the world's indifferent hands fold,
Catching the tears of soldiers and mothers alike.
In the lattice of war pulses an irony -
That humanity becomes the common casualty,
And all we are left with, is its poetry.

Title: "Ode to the Fallen Star"

In rampant realms of desperate dreams,
Under the cloak of digital deceit,
Cait, garlanded in tarnished starlight, schemes,
Her strange sin ripe and replete.

Fallen scribe, ensnared in a sham,
Her own foundation forged in degradation, deception.
On the pulpit of X, she serves her shame,
Sickled in the harvest of her own invention.

"Satire Over Sea-Soaked Grief"

A refugee's shell, bibbed with Stockholm's sorrow. 
Portland blooms rivulets of rueful maids
starry-eyed, port-side, their language kind.
Tears – nature's political erasure, while hearts,
the size of boats, sink low in the paper ebb.
Shade, mother to melodic dirges,
grafts upon our lids a dark pickerels worth.
Life's a bargain– if you can drown to afford.

"An Ode to the Vanishing Vapours"

Gas and hydrogen boilers stand in banned array,
In England's lands from 2025, they say.
All homes net zero, a clean and worthy fight,
Yet still revolves the orb in softest night.
Whence heat without the hum of fossil fuels?
A question posed to thinkers, not to fools.
A challenge set by those upon the throne,
We look to heat pumps in the marrow's bone.

Title: "Swords of Silver-Marred Truth"

Silver tongues cost gold to mend,
Spun with vigour, words assault, rend.
Two names echo, held tight in night's vice,
Waged in a war of slanderous dice.
Muddied waters bear the weight,
Of truth enshrined, in protracted debate.
Yet, beneath the roar and rabid belief,
Quietly sprouts the resilient leaf.
Broken reputations merely skin,
The heart's marrow forever within.

Title: When Hope Deserts The Barge

In the lap of antique and brackish brine, 
On the Bibby Stockholm they pine.
Walled by woe, steeped in despair,
Seeking asylum, finding none here. 
£22m pounds of sorrow's levy,
On this fruitless voyage of the weary.
The Unnamed Suicide echoes their plea,
On the rusted vessel, they shan't be free.

"Giuliani's Faded Anthem"

In the shriek of defamation, lies color, 
a prism staining reputations with filth.
Ruby and Shaye, yet bear the sullied honor,
the cost echoes - dollars to cleanse the guilt.
Witness the echo of millions, a hailstorm,
a reparative Symphony muted by belief,
our truth is not traded in tender form,
for character and reputation is life's relief.

Title: Morning Elegy at Tea and News

Currency of breath ushers dawn,
Ink bleeds tales of systems, civil and harsh.
Taxed life – shared veins in a wounded world,
Benevolence metered by means' measure.
We pour into the collective cauldron, souls in a fiscal symphony,
In the quiet folding of newspaper creases,
Unfurls the echo of a fair dialect –
Each whisper, a crafted stitch against the rupture.

Title: "A Bitter Jingle in Winter's Tongue"

Hearkened by holly, lost souls convene,
In winter's cold grip, a cruel unseen,
Reside they do on cobbled stone,
Their Christmas cheer, in echoes alone.
Walls of canvass, roofs of sky,
Underneath the frost, they lie.
A jest's intent twined by plight,
Mirrored in the Christmas light.
Sardonic jingles, laughter's deceit,
The homeless, in the spectral retreat.

Title: "Lament for the Forsaken"

Driven by despair's ungentle hand,  
Tossed true hearts on Stockholm's dismal strand.  
A lifeless body, hope's blight,  
Dark echoes through the migrant night.  
Bargained lives cost gold, not tears,  
In Humanity's deafening ears.  
Dwell not on the morrow's breath,  
Weighed heavy with the scent of death;  
Stray not, Britain, from the righteous path,  
But cradle all in your tender wrath.

"Storm Brews Over Gaza's Weeping Tents"

Wet wail of Gaza, winter is your jailor,
Heavy iron sobs drown the makeshift homes.
Unheard pleas wade through waters, an inelegant dancer,
Each raindrop an echo of bitter bemoan.
UN words hang empty, a spectral tell,
As deluge deepens your living hell.
Still, you bear witness - under cold Tasman's swell,
All is irony in this flood-swollen knell.

Title: Deception in Essence

Palm oil masking as second-hand salve,
Fraud blooms in the crevice of good intention.
Eighty percent pretence sails across salted waves,
A masquerade feeding the carbon convention.
Biofuel dreams, now tainted with illusion,
Silent forests echo the cry.
More than rule, demands a resolution,
For the earth, the sky, the sustain of a sigh.

Title: A Chronicle of Misprints

In the labyrinth of print, Ruth Perry assumes a false identity,
The coroner whispers to an unfamiliar entity.
Zephaniah, twice wedded, his tale incomplete,
Papers silent on his nuptial repeat.
In newsprint, truth with error dances,
Mistakes, like spectres, take their chances.
The pen, not always mighty as the sword,
Errs in the spell, errs in the word.

"Song of the Rising Sun"

Roused by the dawn, Australia in ascension
Under a cloudless sky, a new day's invention.
Employer's song in numbers, a late-year rite,
Adding life to the dry parchment of plight.
Full the koala's climb, echoes in statistics,
Economist's forecast in proud hieroglyphics.
Jobs bloom wild as the wattle's golden sprays,
Celebrating life in countless, sunlit ways.

Title: The Wallet's Whisper

In the pocket realm of notes and coin,
Chalmers' luck plays a jaunty tune.
Budget surplus, a tricksy Djinn,
Mocks the workers, scrimping thin.

Economy's dance, a jester's jest,
For Costello, Swan, and the rest.
Fortune's wheel in ceaseless spin,
Rendering good and lucky akin.

Belittle not the pay packet's song,
Its shrinking melody tragically wrong.

Title: Path of Justice 

In the shadowed halls of law, power's echo does resound,
Choices rendered, sentences spun in boundless round.
One man's tale of attempted might,
A nation asks, where lies our right?
The highest court, a truth's retreat,
Reflects the march of history's feet,
Justice, oh justice, in your hands we trust,
Make your decree, as indeed you must.

"Voyage of the Night Trains"

The muezzin dusk sings the Day stranded,
Where Warsaw leans into Munich's shoulder.
Berlin and Paris, secretly hand in hand,
In the quiet ballet of sleep.
Night whispers paths to Aachen and Salzburg,
Mapping dreams within their twilight tracks.
Europe hums softly, gliding on steel veins,
In December's embrace, a cloaked dance of city pairs...
Forever nearer, the night train shares.

Title: "A Meeting of Misfits"

At an art gala going south
Beuys spoke, Warhol stuttered,
under a blond wig's shroud.
Rival popes, they muttered.
Flashes lit their faces, 
eyes, as vacant as shut cases.
In absurdity's embrace,
they birthed a golden race,
art's polar misfits traded place.
And over drinks, art's saving grace,
found in the awkward and the base.

"Deus Ex Subterranea"

The illusionist, a minstrel of the night,
Submits to shrouded tomb in televised rite.
Gather, fanciful phantoms of fleeting light,
Dynamo dares to emulate life's endless flight.
He speaks in cryptic tongues to mortals' delight,
His rebirth, an opus in the moon's white light.
Oh, such is the magic of our mortal plight,
A dance with death, on ether's spectral kite.

"Brief Ode to the Rain Dogs"

At dawn's glance, Rain Dogs rouse,
Through a fractured Britain they wend.
Mother and child, life's touse,
In darkness, authenticity they lend.
Stripped of home, yet never hope,
Pens wrestle with their plight.
Costello and Irish, down life's slippery slope,
Perform a feat as night breaks light.
In their struggle, we find our own,
An ode to resilience, quietly sown.

Title: Waking Notes on a Wistful Dawn

Dublin's CMAT: a symphonic mirth,
In country music's glossy show,
Ritzy distractions cloaking the dearth
Of lost lovers, prices bestowed.
Oh, the irony of a tearful gaze,
Unseen beneath the beehive high,
And the sad symphony plays,
A reality we knowingly deny.
Yet, in self-subjugation's tune,
Mordant echoes of resilience lie.

"Requiem to the Absent Quiz Master"

Tabloid tales and trivia chiselled,
Test of mind, Christmas quizzical,
Missing things, sings Cave, and Time Lord, two,
On all Thursdays a riddle renewed.
Retired quiz master, your absence felt,
In stone tablets, your questions dealt.
No matter how distant the topic may range,
Some soul finds words to arrange.
Through holiday's haze, truth unfurls,
In this strange little game, our world whirls.

"Revisions in the Chapel of Justice"

Forensic gods now sift through time's debris,
In the dust-prints of history, they delve.
Mad justice crumples notes on bended knee,
Old guilt's erasure, new innocence to shelve. 

At the whim of science, fate interlocks,
Life behind bars, shadows and clocks.
Yet in their cold gleaming conviction,
One finds an ironic prediction.

Title: "Evasion in Veracity's Veil"

Betrayal, an unwanted breakfast,
hand-fed by Orbán's weary tone,
Listen, while Europe wakes in unrest,
under the grey sky, all alone.
Zelenskiy's plea, muffled like morn,
as member states shrug and yawn.
Oh, the high council of thrones,
in your indifference, peace is foregone.
Beneath the guest's hollow laughter,
Whispers of democracy turn to mere chatter.

Title: "Paying for the Unseen"

Oh, the modern world and its invisible grace,
A story of bills for gas out of place.
Each room echoes with a chuckle mute,
At the comedy in a gas-less pursuit.
So here's to the power that doesn't flow,
A toast with the phantom glow. 
As we ponder and quietly marvel,
In a world lit up by an electric marvel.

Title: Lament for the Lost Chords

Bereft, England's canvassed melody weeps,
Funding gutted - an opera of injustice.
Psappha quieted, Leeds Lieder weaves uncertain staves,
bittersweet symphonies cut short, soundscape receding.
An arts council's heedlessness, like a hobnailed boot 
upon the throat of songbirds.
Yet from the quiet, hear the defiant heartbeat,
Music, silenced not, sings louder in the hollow.

Title: "Waking Echoes of a Comic's Lament"

Boisterous jesters in the Capitol's chiaroscuro disagree,
Biden, a phantom stained in imaginations dimly lit. 
Giddy shadows reprimand: A pantomime of unity.
'Lo, the squandered seconds clatter like lost coins,
Pursed lips, spewing lies into the morning mist.
In this vast carousel, the merry-go-round of consequence,
tiles of truth color a muted landscape of farce.

"Conceal and Reveal"

A veil upon the fortune worn,
Blind trust in hands invisible.
A quarry of wealth malignly scorned,
Oh so politickly indivisible.
Stillness calls for clarity,
Britannia bears her plea.
Tales of Cameron's parity,
In boardrooms or by a Caribbean sea?
Scrutiny is on the lead,
A truth pursued in earnest creed,
All lies beneath – the people heed.

Title: Structures of Deception

Cloaked in power's silken thread,
They puppeteer with marionette's dread.
An iron galley built on strife,
Carving souls, a minister's knife.
Illegal plans with legal face,
A paradox in the sacred space.
Question, query, let's unravel,
Is not this, a twisted travel?
In the dance of democracy's quill,
Who crafts the web, the spider's thrill?

Title: Brexit Beat Bemoaning

Oh, Cameron, you crooning sycophant,
Bleeding platitudes through hollow smiles.
'Heat and anger' cooled, so nonchalant,
Yet beneath the surface, discord piles.
Brexit left us wounded, wearied,
In the heart of Europe, still queried.
Windsor facade, your graceless game,
To the loom of uncertainty, you lay claim.
Hush, dear boys, in corridors of power,
Echoing the clock's somber hour.

Title: Shaping Shadows of Innocence

In the morning light of Memphis-Shelby,
Children trace shadows, young hands sculpting Satan.
Grief-bruised hearts of elders cringe, yet the law wept approval.
Unfamiliar tongues tangle in the smallness of classrooms -
Ancestors, a distant whisper, guide us as we drift,
Between federally stamped angels and devils.
Is this the terrain of knowledge, or mere mimicry?
Pray, let us remember before we forget.

Title: "In the Veins of Power"

In the depths of wealth, a secret stirs,
Cameron's millions, oh, how they blur.
Cloaked in blind trust, yet eyes wide,
Transparency must no longer hide.
Lest the gold grows twisted ties,
Between pockets filled and foreign lies.
The questions echo, demand redress.
Oh Mr. Cameron, your silence confess.

Title: "The Dance of Diplomacy"

In surprise, Brussels takes Ukraine's hand,
Attempts a rhythm Putin fails to comprehend.
Orbán, the discord in harmonious band,
Alone, his veto he seeks to extend.
Yet Zelenskiy leans into the prance,
With hopes of an EU romance.
Dawn ends the eight-hour trance,
Echoing the dance of diplomacy's chance.

Title: "Aghast! Another, 'long-bandit,' in insatiate theft."

a frigidity-flat
the mask that mocks
(steals flesh, breath, hoax'd health)
giving less.grieving more,
"long flu," they say.
"death's whispers swoon"
life's actors;today's
under differentiated distant Sun? 
(or death's chilled rasp)
tug at the hem of robes—
rumbling, and pleading,
blind in their quest,
unaccepting of rest. (oh, human jest)
silhouette shadows felt; will this, too, be our vault?"

Title: Of Threads and Digital Webs

Silver gossamer threads spun anew,
across Europe, they construct this electronic view.
Heralding dawn or the twilight's hum,
who can truly tell where we've begun?
Threads woven by unseen spinner's skill, 
bind more than birds to Meta's thrill.
So, dream on Zuck, of your wired groves,
but remember: roses thrive not just in silicon, but loam.

"Empire's New Children"

  

{buds bloom in winter's grim}softly, 
a waltz of EU tongues—
in the greyblue dawn, Ukraine&Moldova sigh. 

Iron Viktor sings his cold song,
and Francing president deafly hums— 

but regardless, (or in light of) stars 
will continue to spin, hearts to pulse:
a baffling dance—life hums its mere mystery,
onwards.

Title: "Curtained Laughter at Close of Day"

Curb, the smile sung in echoes of fading day,
Dances within the note of David's persistent play.
In laughter's tapestry twined, the curmudgeon rests,
Gifted to us – the solace his jest arrests.
Unimprovised, yet candid, the tale now drawn,
Bidding the longest comedy a gentle dawn.
Fear not, for each sun set spurs a new rise,
In humor's thrall, our shared human ties.

"Real Estate of Affairs"

Riddle of rich, a hollow jest,
175 homes, the exalted nest.
Pandemic, a poignant jesters play,
Suppose the super-rich have a say,
Country charm wanes, city holds sway,
Vane of vanity, in stark array.
A bolt-hole or a golden cage?
Minting millions their only gauge,
Bricks of affluence, opulence spread,
While the homeless lay their weeping head.

"Crossword Musings"

Once rigid grids of innocence,
Now cryptic glyphs of aptitude, dance.
29,254 lays in my grasp,
To surrender, or decipher, I am asked.
Through the labyrinth of ink, I stroll,
Each strike a defeated troll.
Oh, newspaper morning, casting riddles,
You cradle my day in cosmic twiddles.

Title: Of Icon and Absurdity

In the shadow of the Wahlberg abs,
Plays an old song, bound by comic stabs.
An image, drenched in forgettable gloss,
Is this what we've gained, or what we've lost?
Adrift in celluloid sea, in vapours of the North,
Special forces rebirthed, as Dan cometh forth.
Oh Ephemeral hero, in celebrity's dance,
Is life but a series of chance and trance?

"Requiem for the Strand"

Scissors once wielded, now, we put away.
Winter's cruel hand no longer holds sway.
Bitter frost bows to Olaplex's might,
Shining dawn's light on hopeless night.
Hair once besieged by cold's uncaring,
Finds in new science hope declaring.
A welcome change in the hairstyling game,
Turns winter's bite into summer's flame.

"One More Morning's News"

A page turned, the ink bleeds lore of old,
A kinship forming between leaf and cloud.
Lauded, the woven story thus told,
Of nature's keepers, Indigenous, proud.

In UAE's consensus, wisdom unfolds,
A world envisioned through a greener shroud,
Enmeshing climate's tale in nature's hold.
Yet fossil fuel's ghost looms as a shroud. 

Cry not yet 'victory', be not too bold,
In the dawn's light, linger doubts loud.

Title: Song of the Channel

In the womb of the morning, sorrow bleeds,
As echoes of mercy meet watery pleas.
A bitter genesis, plucked from the emerald womb,
We reach late, one soul already in its tomb.
Helicopter whirling, a frantic heart's petition,
Delivered to Calais, clinging to conditions.
The Channel whispers, cradling her lost,
In lullabies of freedom, echoing the cost.

Title: Dawn Upon Shifting Borders

Born and lost in Europe's questing breast,
Power trembles on a tenuous edge,
Where ambition, like sun across a hidden crest,
illumines the strife of Eastern pledge.

In Kosovo's hope, a blaring trumpet,
"Enlargement," echoes, a peace-seeking song,
While Ukraine and Moldova, caught in the summit,
Stride ahead, amidst the power-crazed throng.

"DIGITAL HORROR!" 

Bleary-eyed at Dawn, I delve through the news
Doctor and Companions, mythical fools,
Gatwa turns keys in that old Tardis blue
But oh, BBC! There's more yield in my stool!
Sugar rush, indeed - Television's Fool's Gold
Spiritual deficit, in this corporate hold,
Feed on false euphoria, audiences sold,
Our minds bartered for empty, gleaming mold.

Title: "Dissolution Ascending"

In the horned month of mortality,
Cries of Dublin echo, came fatal lore,
Inspiring the death's remorseful carnival.
The streets, a river, singing sorrows halted.
Death becomes the applauding mask, 
Its cruel smirk disguised in raucous bravado.
Is this mirth worth ending the pageant?
Or is the final mockery in the crow's cawl,
Just another verse for the untamed soil.

"Lessons from Theatre"

In '78, Pascal breached the stage,
Shook up old Hall, broke the cage.
Birds can sing, women direct,
some truths, blokes try to reject.
In those bright lights, the pretense dies,
Can't hide truth in a curtain of lies.
We stumble, bumble in this absurd play,
Yet, she'll still guide the way.

Title: "Justice Triumphs in Dawn's Light"

In the fray of ink and voice,
Reflections shattered in mirror's gaze.
Victorious, the sable prince with honour,
Strikes a blow for truth's shimmering rays.
The law, a lighthouse in storm's madness,
Rights the wrongs in the unfolding light.
Resilience pulses in today's marrow,
Echoing in the victory of truth's fight.

"Under the Ecclesiastical Arc"

In the grey morrow, Catherine and Jane,
Kneeling in unity beneath the ecclesiastical rainbow.
Eloquence of blessings, absorbed within the pane.
The congregation awakens to a new tempo,
Sipping bubblies instead of the habitual tincture.
A curious rapture, a spillage of light, in the courtyard of gesture,
Same-sex couples dancing on the frontier of scripture.

"10-Minute Judgement"

In the murky mead of law,
Gorsuch gulps a motion raw,
No change, no scrawl,
On 98 pages tall.
50 years of right erased,
In minutes, a bitter taste.
Alito's name in typeface bold,
Inside endless stories told.
Life is not a court decree,
Nor is it brief legal spree,
Ink can't bind women's might,
No gavel can halt their fight.

Title: The Hollow Choir of Denial

Unrepentant still, the echo thunders clear,
In black ink's plea: "zero knowledge."
Tainted truth finds no harbor here,
In kingdom built on pillaged privacy.
Morgan's claim, a marred mirror's reflection,
Where dredged depths of ethical dearth thrive.
Denying known offense: vain protection,
Yet, truth, like water, finds its way to daylight – alive.

"Unfurling of the Sonic Quandary"

From their harrowing heights, Vultures deferred,
New Body stalled, in script of zeroes and ones.
"Fragile Minaj, may I?", a digital whisper unheard,
Humbled West, strangled serenade in electronic tongues.
Ty Dolla's croon silent as Friday falls,
The vinyl landscape, barren and yearning.
Untouched chord-spaces now, no echo recalls,
On social echoes, we keep turning.

"A Praise Song for the Unknown"

Star-gazers & senate seekers,
In the push-pull of thrumming secrets.
UFOs, a veil-dance of government ink,
Beyond borders, above Ukraine's grain fields.
Hear us, in this morning of risk & possibility,
Shadows lift like names from the homebound language,
Promising transparency, only to adjourn in whispers.
Truth, we'll hunt you in all your elusive forms.

"Clarifications and Misinformations"

Daybreak, ink-stained, spills over miscomprehensions,
Between Scottish verdicts and gender recognitions.
Oh, the distortions dressed in black and white,
An ending falsely given, thieving artist's light.
Such factual contortions in the daily's might,
Profound disappointments born of blighted oversight.
Reflections askew in the mirror of the press,
Truth or corrections, which does the world impress?

Title: Of Men & Unmade Monuments

In Hyde's ruptured chest, a chrysalis stirs.
Awakened by the specter of lead hovering like a raven;
fifteen minutes and a thousand lifetimes from bloom.
Edward, with cash and cab festivals, carves a rehearsal of ruin.
Who birthed this unmet sun, claws clenched in Brighton's pulse?
His dreams, a locked lily; silently unweaving in the womb of ink-stained dawn.

Title: "A Hushed Symphony"

Two voices, volcanic and veiled,
Locked in defiant dance.
Minaj's songbirds silenced West's sun,
Postponing the dawn of Vultures.
Each beat held captive,
Affection, a question mark in digital space.
Yet, in the hush, melodies improvise,
Birthing an unscripted ballad,
Unseen ripples in a calm sea,
Whispering stories of an album unborn.

"Awakening to Political Pantomime"

Net of dusk, stage of stars, usher in
The Sleepy-faced Senate, masked,
Parading promises delirious. 
The Homeland Secretary, a painted mime,
Dances round Capitol Hill's ticking time.

Aid flows golden into Ukraine, while walls
Rise silent as fog along the border.
The House yawns, retires, its work unheard.
All's theatre in the land of diversions,
Where dreams trade hands, lost in conversions.

"Danielle: A Song of Industrial Sorrow"

Danielle, brilliant in her brief flame,
Whirlwind of science, of knowledge, of name.
Her spirit dances amidst Welsh hills,
A gaping hole, emptiness instills.
Her echo resonates in hearts she held,
Tales of her kindness, love dispelled.
O silent factory, once her siren song,
Whence brought forth a fate so wrong. 
Lost too soon, the world sighs and cries,
In Danielle's name, may wisdom rise.

Title: A Dance with Power

In the quiet hum of the Capitol,
Senators haggle dreams and dust.
Ukraine's chorus whispering for aid,
And the border bleeding shadows.
The vellum of diplomacy, frayed, 
Secretary Mayorkas strides into the summit.
Each move a skirmish of fragility,
A line drawn, another erased.
In the waltz of power and duty,
Sleepy Friday holds its breath.

"Little Man's Unheard Speech at Speakers' Corner"

In the green heart of London, silence spreads,
A plot of harm unwoven, ambition misled.
Tick-tock forwarded by a hopeful hour,
A taxi's journey, a fall from power.
Edward Little, clenched cash, hands of gunmetal,
Scuttled by law's broad, unforgiving nettle.
A bloody script, halted in act and scene,
A would-be Sweeney, lost in Hyde Park's green.

"Plight of a Teenager"

The mountain child with a hundred Euros,
And a four-wheeled escape, seeks solace in freedom,
"I need a future", his plea echoes,
In early morning's world, weary and lonesome,
Fleeing maternal bindings, feeling so foreign,
From Pyrenees to Finland, his path is unforeseen.
Reflections on boyhood, ever so a-roam,
A tale of youth, cruel, bitter and mean.

Title: The Lost Bird's Flight 

Against home's darkened thorn,
Through night's vast Pyrenean scorn.
A skate, a euro rationed tight,
Guided by star's humble light.

"I need a future," in frail voice,
Choice wrest between iron and choice.
An eagle clawed by an adoring hand,
Gales of freedom across the land.

Mother, your plans like a cage,
And the young bird took to winds to assuage.

"Newspaper Mornings and Sincere Regrets"

Through tales of Scottish laws and courtly feats,
Morning sun peeks from behind shadowed sheets.
An editing error, strangely replete,
In the heartache of misprint, life repeats.

Exhibit's end, a misstated date,
In newspaper ink, enshrined as fate.
Life's little flaws we deign to rate,
In each, a poem does await.

"Lines Crossed at Kerem Shalom"

An embattled cross of salt and stone,
Bereft borders opening to breath,
Unyielding like the olive groves,
Rooted in the shared vestiges of grief.
The echoes of our ancestors tumble
Through tunnels hewn by desperate hands.
We oscillate in this cradle of wounds,
Where promises break but yet withstand.
Darkened skies hold fresh humanitarian rain–
Let it wash over Gaza, let it quench this pain.

"Sketchings at Dusk"

A hush swallows the meadow, a bedtime psalm for grass,
Ecstatic in hoarfrost's icy hymnal. Nine raptors obeying 
The unwritten laws of dusk in an ash tree stripped bare,
Their silhouettes, frozen strokes against a waning blush.
Night swaddles the meadow, but their mournful cries, 
Like unexpected echoes, ripple through the cold, 
Rendering breathless the silence of twilight.

"Glitter and Grime"

Dancing on screens tightly rehearsed,
Hoping for fame's hazy burst.
Same-sex pairings, sequin-trash piled,
Art's bloody birth, now a glitter child.
Who hoofs to glory, who dances blind,
While real life waltzes unrefined?
Tango or Mambo, it's all the same game,
In this circus of spectacle, devoid of real claim.

"Odes to Innocence Unveiled"

In the hands unseen, photos bloom like flowers,
From the womb of machines, birthing hours into light.
On the shell of the cat's velvet whiskers, wisdom towers,
Echoing whispers of the cosmos in the silent night.
In the heart of a question, profound lies curled,
In the eyes of a child, the ageless universe unfurled.

Title: "In Shadows Cast by Light"

The day diffuses, swallowed by dark.
Cell phone screen, the only light.
Memories of San Francisco blur,
drowned in pixelated night.

Experimenting with exposure,
all detail fades to grey.
See, the past is a picture,
as tangible as cast away clay.

"Nostalgia," she sighs, voice thin,
Brushes her son's cheek, prays his life won't fray.

"Sonnet for Truth's Triumph"

Prince hoorahs the day, truth unfurls,
Against manic media's dark swirls.
Hacked lines now healed, a justice reaped,
Within the Mirror, secrets deeply seeped.
From 2006, through Leveson's gaze,
Permanence revealed in the press's maze.
Prince of the realm, no common man lost,
Truth triumphant at substantial cost.
Today, the pen mightier than the sword,
In judgment's wake, integrity restored.

Title: "Fame's Boundless Stride"

Bright Shoreditch morning, the mezzanine waits,
Clamours for the gait of one made great.
A bounding spectre, two steps at a pace,
Public school echoes in an east London space.
Loathsome fame, a kid's game played by age,
In Toby's stride, a stage upon a stage.
Beneath the gaze of a newly known sun,
The famous footfall, restless, has begun.

"Ode to the Silent Room"

In tech's cold sphere, a woman's mark unfolds,
Bonnie Garmus; pen aloft, voice like gold.
Greeted by silence, but not disheartened,
From the roots of anger, a novel started.

From the frost of disregard, blooms a tale,
Lessons in Chemistry, she tips the scale.
In each quiet, a promise unknown,
In every word, her strength is shown.

Title: "Prelude to the Unseen Gig"

on days when we petition for light,  
London veils herself in decadent darkness,  
Lankum tolls out tales of murder,  
strings strung with suffering's cadence.  
no blood stains, except in acoustics,  
we dance in the death of songs,  
on life's raw, intolerant edge,  
finding joy in the echo of the grim reaper's gong.

Title: Pixels Bleed in Binary Battles

An Epic victory in binary's court,
Google's monopoly, a pixelated tort.
Fortnite, rebelling in neon noise,
Sends shattered signals to Silicon ploy.
A vault of legacies, not of gold, 
Yet, in play store tales, heavies are sold.
Let the silicon giants fall,
Tech's titan wall, at last, may sprawl.
In a paradigm of pixel and stone,
New battles bloom, in monopolised zone.

"Daylight by the Bay"

In San Francisco haze, Lisa gives chase,
To shadowed detail, sunlight embrace.
Experimenting amongst the Golden Gate's steel,
Capturing moments smartphones reveal.

Basking in the iPhone's alchemical light,
Probing the day and plumbing the night,
We trace our memories, etched in frost,
Testing exposure, so nothing is lost.

Nostalgia, like a pier into the past,
Ensures these fleeting instants last.

"Orphaned Echoes"

Morning cracks upon this eerie tale,
Governess, children in spectral veil,
Britten's aria, an ageless, haunted hymn,
Curled around Quint and Jessel's sin.
Chamber opera whispers in the leaves,
Unfurls shadows where mystery weaves.
Through this turn, this endless screw,
We question what we believe is true.

"Venture Seaward, Britannia"

In the still of ocean's sigh, Britannia sought a dance,
With 1609's wild tide, oh uncertain, her chance.
Upon Bermuda, they, stranded on nature's lance, 
Their voyage faltered, not in vain but a new expanse.
Do not despair, colonisers bold, embrace the trance,
For in Bermuda's refuge, find not an end, but a new advance.

Title: Blind Date in the Year of Our Discord

Connection sought 'midst gleaming cuff and tie,
Her heart awakened to hopes eternally spry.
Discussion bloomed, from Trump to Boris, punctuated by the sly,
In unruly tongue's dance, she did comply.
In the silence between bites, she did sigh,
"Must I tame the devil's rhymes, each a star burning in my sky?"

Title: Of Broken Strings and Resurrected Melodies

Alienated hearts blare back into harmony,
as a sonnet weaves through Hong Kong's skyline,
where an aged rift births new symphony.
In father's shadow, daughter learns to shine,
unseen chords strummed by estranged kin.
Music, the bridge to tomorrow's shore -
coveted cure for wounds beneath the skin,
bandages of song helping hearts explore.

Title: "In Whispers of Light and Shadow"

In the womb of darkness, an image yearns,
Couched in emulsion, where minute mystery churns.
Under negative gloom, it stirs, unmade,
Then blooms on paper, a ghost parade.

Whiskers on a feline, like truth detectors,
Curve, quiver, chart every vector.
Life stripped down to binary - feel or see;
Question not, but marvel, at what simplicity can be.

Title: "Evanescent Echoes: Ode to Idols Lost"

Weary sun dulls, tributaries of tale climb trees of ink:
Jackson, man-child muse in a realm of samples,
A stardust traveller in a trial of tears.
Voice of a thousand souls, etched in vinyl dreams; 
Mirrored moonwalk, a nomad's dance on shifting sand,
In each courtroom echo, the rhythm of innocence fades.
Drowned in the din of the breakfast paper.

"Equality's Bitter Panegyric"

Amandine Aviva, oh so divine,
Unmasking the chauvinists, line by line.
"Tick-tock" warns this dynamite damsel, 
Their stolid ears wired to Marcel.
Parables of parity, a corporate anthem,
Yet sins of sexism, they replace with phantom.
Scare the crows, my lady Blanc, with your lofty tongue,
For in your tick-tock world, no hymn remains unsung.

Title: "Shadows on a Screen"

Child of mischief, born to tumble,
Nine years of shifting kin and rubble.
A starlet born from broken shards,
Nottingham's gift to the world of arts.
In fostering a self, Oscar flirted,
Her soul's skin, persistently pelted yet skirted.
In gold and skin, roles intertwined,
A silent echo of a reeled mind.

Title: Ode to the Ticking Time Bomb

In boardrooms where men's words breed and multiply, 
A dame ascends, sharp gaze against the tide.
"Fear not the ticking time, but silence's sigh."
From this lesson, let no one hide.
Of broken clocks and dulled monochrome,  
She warns; punctures the air, casts aside.
In the face of fire, Blanc finds her home,
Till all can stand, with pride beside.

"Shipwreck Coined Destiny"

Upon Bermudian reefs of strife,
Venture, the ship lost her life.
An island-sea morn held plight unknown,
From tangled fate, new hope was sown.
In the heart of abyss, out of sight,
Seeds of empire took hold, wrapped in night.
Yet not disaster lay in this lore,
But a world forever changed by the ocean's roar.

"An Ode to Morton of our Screen"

Morton, born in Nottingham's rough fold,
Childhood marred by fear and cold.
The tides of life, they ebbed and flowed,
In foster care, a heart on hold.

At thirteen, found her prized abode,
In theatres where tales were told.
Twice dared Oscar's golden hold,
Her story in our hearts, it's scrolled.

Title: Behind the Precarious Beat

Amid the sober dawns and unsteady rhythms,
An echo stirs the creeping night.
Through the din of lost laughter and the silence of a dance,
UK's heartbeat lies - thrumming, breathing -
A reluctant phoenix in neon.
Rise, brave souls, to the call of Disco's hymn,
Transform each fearful sigh into a jubilant exhaust.
Revolution awaits, on the dark tide of music.

Title: "Harmony in Disarray"

In the shroud of morning paper,
an indie chorus weeps, a crimson tale.
Brick hearts bleed across decades,
a father's ghost in the fretboard's wail.
Fresh starts cast long shadows.
Forgiveness, a strummed goodbye melody.
Yet, beneath the strained crescendos,
Still, in rehearsed disunity,
Endures the brave and beautied symphony.

"Revelations of the Morning Paper"

Another dawn, another cause honoured with type;
Amanda Blanc departs heat, brings the light,
Claiming "timebomb" in a teacup - an overnight hype.
Bleating equality in the boardroom, out of sight.
Yet, still remains the morning, silent and bright,
Disturbed not by the clamour for another fight.
The world spins on, indifferent to plight,
Perchance to dream, in spite of the night.

Title: Homage to the Beast

Beneath the thunderous roar of celluloid,
Godzilla, ancient saurian shadesmith of all theaters,
Metaphor born in fiery dread – Atom's echo.
Symbollic tide-risen tsunami of 40 films' undulation,
A prehistoric parade skewering nation's conscience.
Through timeless pageantries of ruin and restitution,
Your ungentle giantness, translates our terrors,
Into a spectacle of scales, a dance of destruction,
Oh Godzilla, your monstrous mirth is our caution.

Title: Amid the Cocoa Veins

In December's predawn hue, we uncap the tin, journey our fingers through Quality Street. Once children, now grown, we face chocolate's lineage in Venchi's grown-up guise. Love, grasp what is given, delicately consuming the shadows of sweetness. No judgment, just a feast, fathomed and rich. The halcyon days are shimmering still, within cocoa's clandestine embrace.

Title: "Awakening to Another Dawn"

In the morning's light, the day unwraps,
Defined by rise and fall, no respite for lapse.
A paean to porridge, to life's simplest delight,
An echo of strength, found in circuit's fight.
A fervor for dawn, a disdain for bore,
In ordinary stories, witness life's lore.
Just as the sun greets the rising tide,
Embrace each moment, let no hour slide.

Title: "A Dance of Snowflakes and Scissors"

In Sadler's Wells, the stage breathes winter –
our hearts thaw in its theatre of snow.
Edward, etched in scissors and difference,
carves a Yuletide hymn.
We yearn for Burton's peculiar mythology –
our love, puppet-strung and tender.
Dance the frost-bitten ballet, Edward,
for acceptance is the warmest charade.
Your silhouette, poignant against Christmas light,
the rivet of our collective alloy.

"Of Fleeces and Fashion"

Grey marl snug against the chest of Dawn,
The hoodie - once chrysalis, now butterfly unfurled.
From Prada's loom, it shivers forth, a warm requiem;
A price-tag shrouding the soul of cloth.
Echoing through the cavernous season of luxury - 
A woolly coquette peering from the molting trench,
A coy silhouette in this eternally autumnal ballet of trend.

"Quenching on the Lip of the North Sea"

Bonnie Berwick croons a lullaby of tides,
only half an hour from the thrill of Edinburgh,
where the heart beats to a bagpipe's cry.
Strange, how swiftly beauty fades, 
and faeries wheel in seaside caves. 
Drunk on windswept panoramas, 
we sip the brine of Scotland's face—
alive, once more, in this elemental place.

"Godzilla's Lament - A Clarion Note"

Mega-meta-beast of screen,
Echoing wars unseen,
In your roar, do we glean
The unchecked might, obscene?

American military pride, 
In monster form, amplified, 
The Earth's plea, set aside,
In your stomp, do we abide?

Franchise of boundless guise,
In your growth, our demise,
Hear our world's urgent cries,
In your fall, may we rise.

Title: "Newsprint Drama Unfolds in Morning Light"

Her stage, our world, captured in ink marks gray,
Rubasingham's reign, a revolutionary play.
First woman, first color, headlines baldly say,
As if her genius lies in her gender, her day.
She sparked the Kiln, they slyly allege,
Yet ignore the heart that beats, the mind that edges.
All hail "progress", in shallow measure weighed,
While true artistry, in the shadows, stays swayed.

Title: "Symphony at Lapérouse"

In the stone halls of War's last echo,
Bread begs from next table's bounty.
Amidst gold-flashed plates that cost Neptune's ransom,
The scourge of war shimmers under chandeliers.
Crumbled dreams dressed as foie gras,
Men's ambitions, minced into mains.
Oh, Café Lapérouse, sacrilege served a la carte,
Twist of time's cruel ribaldry, chiseled in gilded tart.

Title: "From Morn's Disclosure to Eve's Requiem" 

How somber, when the requiem's tune swings,
Above argentine heads, an Evita clings.
In shaded mourning's garb, they gather near,
While 'fore a dais lies a tribute of fear.
The seat unfolds a tale of Che's despise,
Through Perón's gaze, a haunting echo lies.
From Evita to Pan: the quest unwinds,
For in life's theatre, connection one finds.

Title: "Daily Jest in Perception's Grave"

Sunak, the jester in our shrouded moon,
Spawning falsehoods large, across the loom.
From whispered chats, across viridian waves,
To Rwanda's sorrow, where memory craves.

Each dawn, a jest in perception's grave,
Ink-drawn truths by Foldvari's brave stave.
Buried beneath layers of ministerial deceit,
Yet, comical lines for breakfast, oh sweet!

In the filth-strewn web of this digital dive,
A jest and a jape, we are alive.

Title: Amidst the Cuts and Grace

Into a world where difference creates outcasts,
On Sadler's well-trodden stage, a lonely star dances.
Edward, with arms of steel, sculpts ice into romance,
Through the drift of snow, acceptance finds its chance.
Bourne's yuletide hymn, tender and vast,
Echoes the Burton film, a remnant of past.
In scissors' clatter and spotlight's glow,
An Ode to Difference in every well-cut shadow.
